intro: Radicula mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican radicle, is a small flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water. Radicula mexicana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
